page.title: 11Old Aerodrome, Tockwith.
page.content: A World War 2 bomber training {Royal Air Force}base, known as Marston Moor, covers a substantial area of our block. Soon after the war was over, and the airport ceased to be operational, the land was sold for new uses. The former aircraft hangars and some remaining war-time buildings are owned by the Home Office, and are used to store equipment for civil emergencies, eg fire, drought. The equipment includes old fire engines, nick-named 'Green Goddess', Land Rovers, trailers, lorries and pipes. All are kept in good order ready for use. One hangar is owned by the Ministry of Agriculture and is used to store food. There are several derelict buildings from which museums have recovered world war items.
